summary: The bill, titled the Defending Veterans’ Second Amendment Rights Act (H.R. 962), aims to restrict the Secretary of Veterans Affairs from sharing certain personal information of veterans with the Department of Justice for the National Instant Criminal Background Check System (NICS). Specifically, it prohibits the transmittal of information based solely on a VA determination of service-connected disability. The bill was introduced on February 4, 2025, and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
